peopleAlsoAsk.question: Is there an app for identifying antique furniture?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Curio is designed to make antique identification effortless. Its sleek interface lets you focus on discovering the history and value of your items without any distractions. Download Curio today and let your antiques tell their story! Snap, identify, and explore the fascinating world of antiques with ease.
peopleAlsoAsk.title: Curio - Antique Identifier on the App Store - Apple

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How to identify a piece of antique furniture?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Some of these methods include: (1) Joinery: If a joint has only a few uneven dove-tails, it was likely dove-tailed by hand and is an antique. (2) Symmetry: Exact symmetry likely means that the piece is machine-made and hence, not antique. (3) Finish: If the piece is very old, it may be oil, wax or milk paint.

peopleAlsoAsk.question: How can you tell if old furniture is valuable?
peopleAlsoAsk.snippet: Look for Labels and Dates Some older furniture pieces may have labels, stamps, or even dates engraved into them. If you find one, it could significantly increase the value of the piece. However, this is rare. Labels from modern furniture manufacturers don't add value, and any recent dates or markings are a red flag.
